intro: Eriachne inermis, commonly known as the slender flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in wetland or aquatic environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic organisms. Eriachne inermis is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies.
